p: After being administered EO of C. hystrix, morphological aberration of C. megacephala, C. rufifacies, L. cuprina, and M. domestica larvae exhibited deformed midgut and hindgut, vacuolated fat cells, a decreased number of nuclei in the fat cells, and degenerative nuclei [ 16]. Only the adulticidal toxicity of C. longa, B. rotunda and O. gratissimum EOs combined with insecticides was assessed in this study. More bionomic investigations merit further study to determine the post-exposure of flies; for example, the development of immature stages, adult longevity and survival pattern, reproductive potential, and morphological abnormality.
